body: LEAD: Summerstage Finale Summerstage Finale The Central Park Band Shell was one of New York's more neglected outdoor concert spaces until this year's two-month festival of free jazz, opera, dance and new music called Summerstage transformed it into a showcase for contemporary performing artists. Summerstage ends its season with shows today and
title: GOING OUT GUIDE

body: LEAD: Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Pilar Rioja, renowned for her remarkable repertory of Spanish dance, begins a 15-day engagement tonight at the Repertorio Espanol's Gramercy Arts Theater, at 138 East 27th Street. title: GOING OUT GUIDE

body: LEAD: These days, Salvatore Scotto, a longtime resident and community leader in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn, frequently receives phone calls from real-estate agents wanting to know if any of his properties in the neighborhood are for sale. title: Small Town in the Big City: South Brooklyn Changes

body: LEAD: For more than two years, drivers have suffered through snarled traffic along a 1.7-mile section of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway that has been under repair. title: HIGHWAY TIE-UP STRETCHES 2 YEARS AHEAD

body: LEAD: A section of the Gowanus Expressway in Brooklyn that collapsed yesterday at 12:30 P.M., blocking the artery to Staten Island and Queens for hours. The collapse, at 65th Street, affected two southbound lanes, which were reopened about 4 P.M. A city spokesman said steel plates would be placed over the hole until repairs could be made. A section
title: Hole in Gowanus Expressway Ties Up Traffic

body: LEAD: JAN HODENFIELD remembers six years ago when a town house in Park Slope could be bought for less than $200,000 and Seventh Avenue was mostly bodegas, cobblers and neighborhood bars. Today, brownstones cost $750,000 and a Benetton clothing store opened on the avenue in October. JAN HODENFIELD remembers six years ago when a town house in Park
title: If You're Thinking of Living in:; PARK SLOPE

body: LEAD: A walk tomorrow through Williamsburg is the first in a series of spring tours in Brooklyn that will be sponsored by the Prospect Park Environmental Center. title: Brooklyn Tours

body: LEAD: To the Editor: To the Editor: A little more than a year and a half ago, you published an article of mine (Op-Ed, Aug. 12, 1985) about the language of gentrification in our cities, and especially the erroneous and insulting use of frontier imagery -''urban pioneers'' for example - to discuss gentrifying neighborhoods and their existing
title: A Hill Grows in the Mind of Urban Pioneers

body: LEAD: Air pollution has increased to dangerous levels along major streets in lower Manhattan since one-way tolls were introduced on the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge more than a year ago, according to a new draft study. title: POLLUTION RISE TIED TO ONE-WAY TOLL

body: LEAD: A man wearing the traditional clothing of a Hasidic Jew was shot and critically wounded in an apparent robbery before being found near the Brooklyn docks yesterday morning, the police said. body: LEAD: A husband and his wife were found shot to death with their hands taped behind their backs in their apartment in the Gowanus section of Brooklyn last night, the police said.
